result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dustin J Drahonovsky

records.addlTxt:
Court rescheduled hearing upon request from the defense.  Parties notified of new date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 2:30 pm in Branch 40.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services 09-29-2022 Supervision Report
Received and Filed:  Defense's Motion to Adjourn

Defendant Dustin J Drahonovsky appeared via Zoom.  Attorney Morgan Risseeuw appeared in court.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court set date as requested.  Court ordered all future court hearings to be held in person.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  This matter will be held in person in room 634 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Received and Filed:  Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-1-2022
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Violation Report 6-10-2022

Defendant Dustin J Drahonovsky in court with Attorney Morgan Risseeuw; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Preliminary Hearing Waiver
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-31-2022

Defendant previously posted $8,550 cash bail. Court orders that $5,000 remain and the remaining balance be returned to the remitter. 
Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT for supervision LEVEL 3. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT immediately upon leaving court.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by portable breathalyzers. 
IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No driving without a valid license and state required insurance.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Dustin J Drahonovsky in court with attorney Morgan Risseeuw.  Anthony White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/02/2022@01:30pm
